Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a healthy plant that has enough water.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough water and shows signs of wilting.
The student can represent the importance of water for plants by showing differences between plants with and without water.
The student can show through drawings that plants cannot live or grow if there is no water.
The student can illustrate through patterns that healthy plants need water to grow and survive.
